title: Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally
description: When using the Class File editor (version 20020521), scrolling through the editor is not working as expected. The current workaround is to always use the thumb to scroll.
OB: Scrolling in the Class File Editor is not smooth and only moves one pixel at a time.
EB: Scrolling in the Class File Editor should scroll a full page at a time instead of just one pixel.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:  
1. Put a breakpoint in a Java file, right before a System.out.println statement.  
2. Debug to the breakpoint and step into the println call (Note: I happened to go into StringBuffer first, but all that matters is that you do not have the source for the class you just stepped into).  
3. A Class File Editor will open.  
4. Click on the scrollbar's down arrow.  
Result: The editor only scrolls one pixel at a time.  
5. Click on the scrollbar's background to scroll a page at a time.  
Result: The editor only scrolls about a line at a time when it should be scrolling a page at a time.  
Expected result: Scrolling in the Class File Editor should be smooth and scroll a full page at a time.
